sentences.en: "Silly little boy" was his favourite expression of rebuke to his pupils.
sentences.cn: “愚蠢的小家伙”是他最常用的斥责其学生的言辞。

sentences.en: Carrie instantly brightened up, thinking he had meant it as a rebuke.
sentences.cn: 嘉莉立刻露出高兴的脸色, 以为他的意思是在指责她.

sentences.en: Dorothea checked herself suddenly with self - rebuke for the presumptuous way.
sentences.cn: 多萝西娅想到这里,蓦地打住了,责备自己捕风捉影.

sentences.en: Even one minute's lateness would earn a stern rebuke.
sentences.cn: 哪怕迟到一分钟也将受到严厉的斥责.

sentences.en: Georgos accepted the rebuke silently, though he didn't have to.
sentences.cn: 乔戈斯默默地接受了责难, 虽然他并不是非这样做不可.

sentences.en: He had to put up with a smart rebuke from the teacher.
sentences.cn: 他不得不忍受老师的严厉指责.

sentences.en: Her pleasure at hearing his voice was a rebuke to him.
sentences.cn: 她听到他声音的高兴劲对他来说是一种遣责.

sentences.en: Her rebuke and her mood seemed to fill the whole room.
sentences.cn: 她的责问和怒容好象布满了整个房子.

sentences.en: His statements drew a stinging rebuke from the chairman.
sentences.cn: 他的申明受到了主席严厉的谴责。

sentences.en: I stood abashed at his rebuke.
sentences.cn: 面对他的斥责我感到无地自容.

sentences.en: It is a mark of depravity to make a mock of good advice and kind rebuke.
sentences.cn: 嘲笑别人的忠告和善意指责是堕落的标志.
这番申斥获得了高声的喝彩.

sentences.en: Mason took the rebuke lightly and turned again to Clyde.
sentences.cn: 梅森对这指责满不在乎,就又朝克莱德这边回过头来.

sentences.en: Rocco accepted the rebuke in silence.
sentences.cn: 对这样的反驳,罗科默默地接受了下来.

sentences.en: The president rebuked the House and Senate for not passing those bills within 100 days.
sentences.cn: 总统谴责参众两院未在100天内通过那些法案。

sentences.en: The rebuke was so gently given that Arthur hardly coloured under it.
sentences.cn: 这些责备的话说得很温和,使得亚瑟听了连脸都不曾红起来.

phrases.tran_cn: 无可指摘的；无可非议的

trans.tran_en: to speak to someone severely about something they have done wrong

trans.tran_cn: 非难，指责，制止，阻止，使相形见绌，惩戒
